oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Some random reminiscences of an octogenarian, 1944 April 08
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A typewritten speech by Clarence B. Wallace for an address presented to the Mid-South Association, circa April 8th, 1944, titled “Some Random Reminiscens of an Octogenarian.” Professor Wallace, a graduate of Hampden-Sydney and the University of Virginia, was a founder and headmaster of Wallace University School, a preparatory school for Vanderbilt University. Professor Wallace was the school’s sole headmaster for its 55-year existence from ca.1886 - ca. 1941. Forms part of the Clarence Wallace Bainbridge Collection. 1 typescript.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wallace, Clarence B., 1859-1950
